subject: RE: Antwort: [junit] junit 3.5 and visua age 3.5
msgSnippet: I ve been out of the loop for over a week, please excuse me if this has already been answered.  JUnit3.2 is available from the files section of the
messageBody:
I've been out of the loop for over a week, please excuse
me if this has already been answered. JUnit3.2 is
available from the files section of the extremeprogramming
group.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Warsa, Steve [mailto:steve.warsa@...]
> Sent: Monday, February 19, 2001 7:19 AM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: Antwort: [junit] junit 3.5 and visua age 3.5
>
>
> How can I get to the JUnit version 3.2 download?
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ralf.Espenschied@... [mailto:Ralf.Espenschied@...]
> Sent: Thursday, February 15, 2001 2:24 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Cc: leon@...
> Subject: Antwort: [junit] junit 3.5 and visua age 3.5
>
>
>
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I have a solution for that:
> - use the vaj\tools\test-ui directory from JUnit 3.2
> hint: for those people who create the JUnit zip file, please insert the
> vaj-related stuff next time
>
> - install the tool according to the doc\vaj\vaj.htm file from JUnit 3.2
> except
> for the following point "Installing JUnit as a VisualAge for Java tool"
> -> replace point 2, last item ("click Edit... and enter JUnit")
> with "click
> Edit
> ... Add Directory... choose JUnit from your project-resources tree (e.g.
> c:\program files\IBM\VisualAge for Java\ide\project_resources\JUnit)
> hint: could someone add this in the documentation for VisualAge 3.0 and
> newer
> versions
>
> In my case the sample tests run successfully.
>
> Hope it helps, Ralf.
>
>
>
>
>
>
> "Leon Webster" <leon@...> on 15.02.2001 04:30:43
>
> Bitte antworten an junit@yahoogroups.com
>
> An: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Kopie: (Blindkopie: Ralf Espenschied/TLC/DE)
> Thema: [junit] junit 3.5 and visua age 3.5
>
>
>
> I am sure I am having a pre-mature "senior moment" here, but
> perhaps someone
> can help me. I am having trouble installing JUnit as a Visual
> Age for Java
> tool.
>
> The instructions for running Junit from within Visual Age say
> "1. copy the directory vaj\tools\test-ui into the
> VAJ_INSTALLDIR\ide\tools
> directory"
>
> I can't locate the directory "vaj\tools\test-ui" in JUnit3.5.zip. I am
> pretty sure it was there in JUnit 3.2 (but not absolutely sure). I can't
> find a place on JUnit.org to download the file.
>
> Can some one point me in the right direction?
>
> Thanks much.
>
> Leon Webster
>
>
>
